intro: Neuwiedia zollingeri var. javanica, commonly known as the Javanese Neuwiedia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in clusters. The plant has elliptical, dark green leaves with a slightly waxy texture. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
